result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by the Defendant inquiring if he qualifies for good time credit on his revoked sentence.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian on 1/28/15 no action.

Defendant Joshua M Kafura in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF1008. Court grants the State's motion. Conditions of bail are remitted.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua M Kafura in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua M Kafura in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests bail be modified from $3000.00 to $2000.00 and conditions modified to reflect NO VIOLENT contact with Karissa H. State objects.  Court denies the motion to modify bail in any way, shape or form. Defense requests a different date in 30 days for plea and sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
